description: In this series, we will take a look at creating functions as a way to collect logic into a reusable chunk. If you want to explore how to create and utilize functions to make your code more readable and maintainable, then join us there!

episodes.title: What is a Function

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach explore creating out first function in Python. Justin discusses the syntax as well as some edge cases to consider when creating a function. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of a function to collect programs into a more predictable format.
episodes.title: Creating a Function

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach continue expanding on simple functions that can be used to create more complex programs.
episodes.title: Functions without Arguments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach expand the creation of functions by adding a single argument or parameter to the function. Additionally, Justin discusses that parameters can be positional in nature where the order dictates how the function runs.
episodes.title: Functions with a Single Positional Argument

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach take a look at functions with a single keyword argument which is like a named or labeled argument. Justin also explores the difference in readability and use of keyword arguments versus positional arguments.
